metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: JavaScript Object Constructors
Object Constructor Functions
Sometimes we need to create many objects of the same type .
content.html: Sometimes we need to create many objects of the same type.

content.text: To create an object type we use an object constructor function .
content.html: To create an object type we use an object constructor function.

content.text: It is considered good practice to name constructor functions with an upper-case first letter.
content.html: It is considered good practice to name constructor functions with an upper-case first letter.

content.code_html:
function Person(first, last, age, eye) {
  this.firstName = first;
  this.lastName = last;
  this.age = age;
  this.eyeColor = eye;
}

content.text: Note:
In the constructor function, this has no value.
content.html: In the constructor function, this has no value.

content.text: The value of this will become the new object when a new object is created.
content.html: The value of this will become the new object when a new object is created.

content.text: See Also:
The JavaScript this Tutorial
content.html: The JavaScript this Tutorial

content.text: Now we can use new Person() to create many new Person objects:
content.html: Now we can use new Person() to create many new Person objects:

content.code_html:
const myFather = new Person("John", "Doe", 50, "blue");
const myMother = new Person("Sally", "Rally", 48, "green");
const mySister = new Person("Anna", "Rally", 18, "green");

const mySelf = new Person("Johnny", "Rally", 22, "green");

content.text: Property Default Values
A value given to a property will be a default value for all objects created by the constructor:
content.html: A value given to a property will be a default value for all objects created by the constructor:

content.code_html:
function Person(first, last, age, eyecolor) {
  this.firstName = first;
  this.lastName = last;
  this.age = age;
  this.eyeColor = eyecolor;
  this.nationality = "English";
}

content.text: Adding a Property to an Object
Adding a property to a created object is easy:
content.html: Adding a property to a created object is easy:

content.code_html: myFather.nationality = "English";

content.text: Note:
The new property will be added to myFather . Not to any other Person Objects .
content.html: The new property will be added to myFather. Not to any other Person Objects.

content.text: Adding a Property to a Constructor
You can NOT add a new property to an object constructor:
content.html: You can NOT add a new property to an object constructor:

content.code_html: Person.nationality = "English";

content.text: To add a new property, you must add it to the constructor function prototype:
content.html: To add a new property, you must add it to the constructor function prototype:

content.code_html: Person.prototype.nationality = "English";

content.text: Constructor Function Methods
A constructor function can also have methods :
content.html: A constructor function can also have methods:

content.code_html:
function Person(first, last, age, eyecolor) {
  this.firstName = first;
  this.lastName = last;
  this.age = age;
  this.eyeColor = eyecolor;
  this.fullName = function() {
    return this.firstName + " " + this.lastName;
  };
}

content.text: Adding a Method to an Object
Adding a method to a created object is easy:
content.html: Adding a method to a created object is easy:

content.code_html:
myMother.changeName = function (name) {
  this.lastName = name;
}

content.text: Note:
The new method will be added to myMother . Not to any other Person Objects .
content.html: The new method will be added to myMother. Not to any other Person Objects.

content.text: Adding a Method to a Constructor
You cannot add a new method to an object constructor function.
content.html: You cannot add a new method to an object constructor function.

content.text: This code will produce a TypeError:
content.html: This code will produce a TypeError:

content.code_html:
Person.changeName = function (name) {
  this.lastName = name;
}

myMother.changeName("Doe");

content.text: Adding a new method must be done to the constructor function prototype:
content.html: Adding a new method must be done to the constructor function prototype:

content.code_html:
Person.prototype.changeName = function (name) {
  this.lastName = name;
}

myMother.changeName("Doe");

content.text: Note:
The changeName() function assigns the value of name to the person's lastName property, substituting this with myMother .
content.html: The changeName() function assigns the value of name to the person's lastName property, substituting this with myMother.

content.text: Built-in JavaScript Constructors
JavaScript has built-in constructors for all native objects:
content.html: JavaScript has built-in constructors for all native objects:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
new Object()   // A new Object object
new Array()    // A new Array object
new Map()      // A new Map object
new Set()      // A new Set object
new Date()     // A new Date object
new RegExp()   // A new RegExp object
new Function() // A new Function object

content.code:
new Object()   // A new Object object
new Array()    // A new Array object
new Map()      // A new Map object
new Set()      // A new Set object
new Date()     // A new Date object
new RegExp()   // A new RegExp object
new Function() // A new Function object

syntax_highlighting.text:
new Object()   // A new Object object
new Array()    // A new Array object
new Map()      // A new Map object
new Set()      // A new Set object
new Date()     // A new Date object
new RegExp()   // A new RegExp object
new Function() // A new Function object

content.code_html:
new Object()   // A new Object object
 new Array()    // A new Array object
 new Map()      // A new Map object
 new Set()      // A new Set object
 new Date()     // A new Date object
 new RegExp()   // A new RegExp object
 new Function() // A new Function object

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
new Object()   // A new Object object
new Array()    // A new Array object
new Map()      // A new Map object
new Set()      // A new Set object
new Date()     // A new Date object
new RegExp()   // A new RegExp object
new Function() // A new Function object

content.text: Note:
The Math() object is not in the list. Math is a global object. The new keyword cannot be used on Math .
content.html: The Math() object is not in the list. Math is a global object. The new keyword cannot be used on Math.

content.text: Did You Know?
Use object literals {} instead of new Object() .
content.html: Use object literals {} instead of new Object().

content.text: Use array literals [] instead of new Array() .
content.html: Use array literals [] instead of new Array().

content.text: Use pattern literals /()/ instead of new RegExp() .
content.html: Use pattern literals /()/ instead of new RegExp().

content.text: Use function expressions () {} instead of new Function() .
content.html: Use function expressions () {} instead of new Function().

syntaxHighlighting.text:
"";           // primitive string
0;            // primitive number
false;        // primitive boolean

{};           // object object
[];           // array object
/()/          // regexp object
function(){}; // function

content.code:
"";           // primitive string
0;            // primitive number
false;        // primitive boolean

{};           // object object
[];           // array object
/()/          // regexp object
function(){}; // function
